page.title: 03EMPLOYMENT
page.content: For a century,Ruabon has been famous for the distinctive red products of its two brickworks employing some 200 men.Few people in Ruabon today,however,rely on the clay pit for a living. The many small pits of the 19th century now only provide work for a few men at Bersham Colliery 5 miles away. Ruabon used to be a busy GWR junction in North Wales providing work for many of the working population.However,in 1960 the line to Barmouth was closed and the jobs on the railway at Ruabon declined rapidly. A chemical company,a gas engineering works and an idustrial estate of small factories now employ many.The local authority employs many to serve a large housing and leisure complex at Plas Madoc,Acrefair.
